abstract: When Facebook signed up its 100 millionth member last August, its employees spread out in two parks in Palo Alto, Calif., for a huge barbecue. Sometime this week, this five-year-old start-up, born in a dorm room at Harvard, expects to register its 200 millionth user, The New York Times’s Brad Stone reported Sunday.
lead_paragraph: When Facebook signed up its 100 millionth member last August, its employees spread out in two parks in Palo Alto, Calif., for a huge barbecue. Sometime this week, this five-year-old start-up, born in a dorm room at Harvard, expects to register its 200 millionth user, The New York Times’s Brad Stone reported Sunday.

headline.main: Is Facebook Growing Up Too Fast?
